greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Heinz number of the multiset of differences between consecutive divisors of n.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition or multiset {y_1,...,y_k} is prime(y_1)*...*prime(y_k).
formula: A056239(a(n)) = n - 1. In words, the integer partition with Heinz number a(n) is an integer partition of n - 1.
example: The sequence of terms together with their prime indices begins:
For example, the divisors of 6 are {1,2,3,6}, with differences {1,1,3}, with Heinz number 20, so a(6) = 20.
xref: a(n) is the Heinz number of row n of A193829, A328025, or A328027.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 02 2019
